name: places/ChIJ9XQJEhhawokR-OUFlT4C5Jk
formattedAddress: 129 Fulton St, New York, NY 10038, USA
adrFormatAddress: 129 Fulton St, New York, NY 10038, USA

editorialSummary.text: Drugstore chain selling a variety of beauty & health products, plus some grocery & household items.

originalText.text: Decent store but if you are looking for alcohol, they have a very limited and subpar collection. The store itself is clean but we were creeped out by people standing there simply staring at the customers.

text.text: Decent store but if you are looking for alcohol, they have a very limited and subpar collection. The store itself is clean but we were creeped out by people standing there simply staring at the customers.

originalText.text:
My brother is a pharmacist which has thought me that Pharmacists are truly amazing people that deserve respect and CVS is notoriously one of the most vicious employers for these well-educated workers. That said, I’ve never been gaslit by a pharmacist when following through on verifying quantity of stock before my psychiatry appointment. There’s no excuse for how I was treated and it was inappropriate at best.

When calling in asking a simple question about a prescription I was met with being told to stop trying to get my prescription because no one has it. I asked about an alternative I use in case of stock issues and he cut me off saying to stop trying.

I told him I had just called a location and found out they had it in a small quantity and that I was using this as a potential backup option. He said to stop calling this place- thanks for calling, then hung up.

Needless to say, I moved here for school. These meds are for school. I asked a simple question and was bombarded to stop calling CVSs and harassing them. This was the first time I had called this pharmacy, and the second call I’ve ever made to a CVS in NYC.

I don’t usually write negative reviews, and people have tough days- they are entitled to their feelings . But, this is my third week in the city and no one deserves to be yelled at when they are following instructions from their doctor.

originalText.text: I've been going to CVS at 129 Fulton St, NY, NY for decades. In the last year, they've made numerous errors with my family's prescriptions - incorrect dosages mostly and texting me that a prescription was ready when it wasn't.  The reason for the text their rep explained, was that they want you to come in and purchase shampoo, CVS's errors have caused major problems and, if I didn't catch them, could have led to worsening medical issues.  I've complained to the pharmacists and the customer service representatives to no avail.  I'd be very cautious about using this pharmacy. I'm considering changing after all these years.

originalText.text: I've lived in the neighborhood for 7 years.  I love the crew there.  Especially Lissette!!!  She is always so friendly and helpful and asks about my pet and it makes my day when I get to run into her there.  There is a Duane Reade that is closer to me,  but I honestly walk the extra block in case Lissette is working.

originalText.text: great store. always clean, professional staff, great prices and discounts. I never have issues and I shop there almost daily. highly recommend.
